title: Megan McKenna opens up about having therapy following Mike Thalassitis’s suicide
text:
Megan McKenna has revealed she’s had therapy (Picture: Getty)

Megan McKenna has bravely talked about seeking professional help this year to ‘deal with her emotions’.

The 27-year-old star, who is currently taking part in X Factor: Celebrity alongside the likes of Love Island’s Samira Mighty, sadly lost her ex-boyfriend Mike Thalassitis to suicide in March aged 26.

Speaking about how she’s coping with her mental health, Megan said: ‘Obviously, this year I’ve had a few little panic attacks.’

She added to The Sun: ‘I’ve had therapy because as much as I have people around me to talk to, speaking to someone I don’t really know just helps me to deal with emotions and put things in the right place.’

Mike took his own life after consuming cocaine and alcohol an inquest heard back in June, with his cause of death ruled as cerebral hypoxia by hanging.

Megan and Mike broke up last August (Picture: Getty)

Megan and Mike had dated for seven months before going their separate ways in August 2018.

Addressing his sad passing, she wrote in an Instagram post: ‘Sorry I haven’t been on social media but I’m in complete shock and trying to come to terms with this.

‘I can’t believe I’m even writing this post.

‘My thoughts and prayers are with Mike’s family. Rest in peace Mike.’

In the same interview, Megan also discussed having body image issues.

‘I became obsessed with my lips. I’d take a photo of myself and if I didn’t think they looked big enough I’d make them bigger with an editing app,’ she admitted.

‘Honestly, I think I had body dysmorphia because when I look back at pictures of myself now I am horrified. I look like a duck.

‘I don’t know how they didn’t bump into things! I can’t believe what I looked like.’
